moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Be3 e6 7. Be2 Be7 8. a4 Nc6 9. O-O O-O 10. f4 Qc7
1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Be3 e6 7. Be2 Be7 8. a4 Nc6 9. O-O O-O 10. f4 Qc7 11. Kh1 Re8
comment: While this move has the virtue of clearing for ...Be7-f8 and ...e6-e5 with some chance of play on the e-file, it also neglects the queen-side Bc8 & Ra8.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Be3 e6 7. Be2 Be7 8. a4 Nc6 9. O-O O-O 10. f4 Qc7 11. Kh1 Re8 12. Bf3 Bf8
comment: Black doesn't fear White's plan and plans the counter strike ...e6-e5.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Be3 e6 7. Be2 Be7 8. a4 Nc6 9. O-O O-O 10. f4 Qc7 11. Kh1 Re8 12. Bf3 Bf8 13. Nb3
comment: but this takes pressure off Nc6, so Black can develop his queen-side freely.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Be3 e6 7. Be2 Be7 8. a4 Nc6 9. O-O O-O 10. f4 Qc7 11. Kh1 Re8 12. Bf3 Bf8 13. Nb3 b6 14. a5 bxa5 15. e5 dxe5 16. fxe5 Rd8
comment: Black takes this moment to transfer the rook to a more active square.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Be3 e6 7. Be2 Be7 8. a4 Nc6 9. O-O O-O 10. f4 Qc7 11. Kh1 Re8 12. Bf3 Bf8 13. Nb3 b6 14. a5 bxa5 15. e5 dxe5 16. fxe5 Rd8 17. Nd4 Nxd4
comment: I'm not certain this was necessary, but it challenges White immediately and makes the game interesting.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Be3 e6 7. Be2 Be7 8. a4 Nc6 9. O-O O-O 10. f4 Qc7 11. Kh1 Re8 12. Bf3 Bf8 13. Nb3 b6 14. a5 bxa5 15. e5 dxe5 16. fxe5 Rd8 17. Nd4 Nxd4 18. Bxa8 Qxe5 19. Bg1 Be7
comment: White's queen is feeling the pinch as any move from Nd4 discovers an attack on Qd1 and the queen is tied to Pc2.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Be3 e6 7. Be2 Be7 8. a4 Nc6 9. O-O O-O 10. f4 Qc7 11. Kh1 Re8 12. Bf3 Bf8 13. Nb3 b6 14. a5 bxa5 15. e5 dxe5 16. fxe5 Rd8 17. Nd4 Nxd4 18. Bxa8 Qxe5 19. Bg1 Be7 20. Nd5
comment: This is a desperate measure for certain. It's a "trick" to trade Nc3 for Nd4, which helps White block the d-file too.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Be3 e6 7. Be2 Be7 8. a4 Nc6 9. O-O O-O 10. f4 Qc7 11. Kh1 Re8 12. Bf3 Bf8 13. Nb3 b6 14. a5 bxa5 15. e5 dxe5 16. fxe5 Rd8 17. Nd4 Nxd4 18. Bxa8 Qxe5 19. Bg1 Be7 20. Nd5 Nxd5 21. Bxd4 Qb8 22. Qh5 f5 23. Bxd5 Rxd5
comment: Black has a bishop plus two pawns for White's rook, but Black's doubled a-file pawns aren't so great. I suppose a lot depends upon whether White can find a way to utilize all his pieces. If Black can shut out one or two of White's pieces then his pawns might have a say in the outcome. Pg7 is an obvious target, but ...e6-e5 could shut out Bd4.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Be3 e6 7. Be2 Be7 8. a4 Nc6 9. O-O O-O 10. f4 Qc7 11. Kh1 Re8 12. Bf3 Bf8 13. Nb3 b6 14. a5 bxa5 15. e5 dxe5 16. fxe5 Rd8 17. Nd4 Nxd4 18. Bxa8 Qxe5 19. Bg1 Be7 20. Nd5 Nxd5 21. Bxd4 Qb8 22. Qh5 f5 23. Bxd5 Rxd5 24. Qe8+ Bf8 25. Bc3 Qb7 26. Rxa5
comment: I don't see how trading Pb2 for Pa5 could be good. It makes Black's Pa6 a passer.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Be3 e6 7. Be2 Be7 8. a4 Nc6 9. O-O O-O 10. f4 Qc7 11. Kh1 Re8 12. Bf3 Bf8 13. Nb3 b6 14. a5 bxa5 15. e5 dxe5 16. fxe5 Rd8 17. Nd4 Nxd4 18. Bxa8 Qxe5 19. Bg1 Be7 20. Nd5 Nxd5 21. Bxd4 Qb8 22. Qh5 f5 23. Bxd5 Rxd5 24. Qe8+ Bf8 25. Bc3 Qb7 26. Rxa5 Bd7 27. Qh5 Rxa5 28. Bxa5 Qxb2 29. Qe2 Qa2
comment: defending against Qxe6+, so Bd7-b5 is a real threat AND threatening Ba5

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Be3 e6 7. Be2 Be7 8. a4 Nc6 9. O-O O-O 10. f4 Qc7 11. Kh1 Re8 12. Bf3 Bf8 13. Nb3 b6 14. a5 bxa5 15. e5 dxe5 16. fxe5 Rd8 17. Nd4 Nxd4 18. Bxa8 Qxe5 19. Bg1 Be7 20. Nd5 Nxd5 21. Bxd4 Qb8 22. Qh5 f5 23. Bxd5 Rxd5 24. Qe8+ Bf8 25. Bc3 Qb7 26. Rxa5 Bd7 27. Qh5 Rxa5 28. Bxa5 Qxb2 29. Qe2 Qa2 30. Qd2 Bc6 31. Rc1 Qc4
comment: quickly preventing c2-c4, so it's only Black's Pa6 which might have a good chance of advancing. Still, it's very close to equal.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Be3 e6 7. Be2 Be7 8. a4 Nc6 9. O-O O-O 10. f4 Qc7 11. Kh1 Re8 12. Bf3 Bf8 13. Nb3 b6 14. a5 bxa5 15. e5 dxe5 16. fxe5 Rd8 17. Nd4 Nxd4 18. Bxa8 Qxe5 19. Bg1 Be7 20. Nd5 Nxd5 21. Bxd4 Qb8 22. Qh5 f5 23. Bxd5 Rxd5 24. Qe8+ Bf8 25. Bc3 Qb7 26. Rxa5 Bd7 27. Qh5 Rxa5 28. Bxa5 Qxb2 29. Qe2 Qa2 30. Qd2 Bc6 31. Rc1 Qc4 32. c3 Be7 33. Bd8 Bc5 34. Bg5 h6 35. Be3 Be7
comment: Black avoids trades because he'll need both bishops to guard the many squares necessary for either an offense or a defense to work.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Be3 e6 7. Be2 Be7 8. a4 Nc6 9. O-O O-O 10. f4 Qc7 11. Kh1 Re8 12. Bf3 Bf8 13. Nb3 b6 14. a5 bxa5 15. e5 dxe5 16. fxe5 Rd8 17. Nd4 Nxd4 18. Bxa8 Qxe5 19. Bg1 Be7 20. Nd5 Nxd5 21. Bxd4 Qb8 22. Qh5 f5 23. Bxd5 Rxd5 24. Qe8+ Bf8 25. Bc3 Qb7 26. Rxa5 Bd7 27. Qh5 Rxa5 28. Bxa5 Qxb2 29. Qe2 Qa2 30. Qd2 Bc6 31. Rc1 Qc4 32. c3 Be7 33. Bd8 Bc5 34. Bg5 h6 35. Be3 Be7 36. Rb1 a5 37. Kg1 a4 38. Bd4 a3 39. Ra1 Bd5 40. Qe3 a2
comment: This ensures Black all the winning chances. Ra1 won't be able to do anything offensively so long as Pa2 threatens to advance.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Be3 e6 7. Be2 Be7 8. a4 Nc6 9. O-O O-O 10. f4 Qc7 11. Kh1 Re8 12. Bf3 Bf8 13. Nb3 b6 14. a5 bxa5 15. e5 dxe5 16. fxe5 Rd8 17. Nd4 Nxd4 18. Bxa8 Qxe5 19. Bg1 Be7 20. Nd5 Nxd5 21. Bxd4 Qb8 22. Qh5 f5 23. Bxd5 Rxd5 24. Qe8+ Bf8 25. Bc3 Qb7 26. Rxa5 Bd7 27. Qh5 Rxa5 28. Bxa5 Qxb2 29. Qe2 Qa2 30. Qd2 Bc6 31. Rc1 Qc4 32. c3 Be7 33. Bd8 Bc5 34. Bg5 h6 35. Be3 Be7 36. Rb1 a5 37. Kg1 a4 38. Bd4 a3 39. Ra1 Bd5 40. Qe3 a2 41. Qg3 Bf8 42. Rc1 Be4

1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Be3 e6 7. Be2 Be7 8. a4 Nc6 9. O-O O-O 10. f4 Qc7 11. Kh1 Re8 12. Bf3 Bf8 13. Nb3 b6 14. a5 bxa5 15. e5 dxe5 16. fxe5 Rd8 17. Nd4 Nxd4 18. Bxa8 Qxe5 19. Bg1 Be7 20. Nd5 Nxd5 21. Bxd4 Qb8 22. Qh5 f5 23. Bxd5 Rxd5 24. Qe8+ Bf8 25. Bc3 Qb7 26. Rxa5 Bd7 27. Qh5 Rxa5 28. Bxa5 Qxb2 29. Qe2 Qa2 30. Qd2 Bc6 31. Rc1 Qc4 32. c3 Be7 33. Bd8 Bc5 34. Bg5 h6 35. Be3 Be7 36. Rb1 a5 37. Kg1 a4 38. Bd4 a3 39. Ra1 Bd5 40. Qe3 a2 41. Qg3 Bf8 42. Rc1 Be4 43. Qe1
comment: White is essentially offering to trade Black's bishop and pawn for rook, to play the ending one pawn down, but with much better drawing chances. Black, on the other hand, has the threat of advancing Pa2 and more pawns on the king-side. So, he might attack Kg1 or threaten to advance Pe6 while using Pa2 as a constant diversionary threat.

moves: 1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Be3 e6 7. Be2 Be7 8. a4 Nc6 9. O-O O-O 10. f4 Qc7 11. Kh1 Re8 12. Bf3 Bf8 13. Nb3 b6 14. a5 bxa5 15. e5 dxe5 16. fxe5 Rd8 17. Rc1 Qc4 32. c3 Be7 33. Bd8 Bc5 34. Bg5 h6 35. Be3 Be7 36. Rb1 a5 37. Kg1 a4 38. Bd4 a3 39. Ra1 Bd5 40. Qe3 a2 41. Qg3 Bf8 42. Rc1 Be4 43. Qe1 Bd6 44. h3 Qd3 45. Ra1 Qc2
comment: White can't find an adequate mechanism to prevent Black's many threats.
